page.title: 06MONEYLENDERS
page.content: Jean and Colin were short of money. Colin had just found a new job after six months unemployment and their children needed new clothes and shoes. One morning a man knocked at the door and offered to help out with their money problem. He sugested a loan of {Â£50}to be paid back at{Â£2.50}per week. Jean accepted his offer and took the money, but she did not sign any documents. The moneylender did not mention how much interest she would have to repay on the loan. By the time most of the payments had been made, Jean was again very short of money and was persuaded to borrow a further{Â£75}to pay off the original loan and give her cash to spend. After two more loans Jean was repaying {Â£16}per week which she could not afford and the total amount she owed was now many hundreds of pounds.
